parallel.distributed

Class BCastSrv

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.distributed.BCastSrv

  • public final class BCastSrv
extends java.lang.Object
    A broadcast object server, that broadcasts to all clients connected to it, any object received by any of the connected clients. Usually, the object to be broadcast is a double value (useful with the DAccumulator[Srv|Clt] set of classes) but doesn't have to be. It is also very useful in any case where it is needed to broadcast objects to all connected parties. One nice Use-Case is when there is a need to send a notification (in the form of a string) to all interested parties when an Oracle RDBMS table is modified (let's say by an SQL INSERT): a very small Java class can be written that simply connects to a BCastSrv and sends the required message (see the class OrclEvtNotifier in the tests package.) The broadcast server then broadcasts the message to all connected parties, and the required functionality is achieved. Notice that the object is not echoed back to the sender but only to the rest of the (currently) connected parties.

    Notice the use of the java.nio package for this server's functionalities. The class is inspired after Greg Travis's Server class example on nio. See the article on JavaWorld: http://www.javaworld.com/article/2073344/core-java/use-select-for-high-speed-networking.html

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java
